meanings.definition: The state or quality of being raw.
meanings.sent1: The rawnesses of the meat made it difficult to chew.
meanings.sent2: I could taste the rawnesses of the vegetables in the salad.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked about the rawnesses of his cooking skills.
meanings.sent4: The rawnesses of the emotion in her voice was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The rawnesses of the wound were a reminder of the accident.

meanings.definition: The raw or uncooked state of something.
meanings.sent1: She preferred the rawnesses of sushi over cooked dishes.
meanings.sent2: The rawnesses of the dough needed to be baked before eating.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was ruined by the rawnesses of the chicken.
meanings.sent4: The rawnesses of the clay made it perfect for sculpting.
meanings.sent5: The rawnesses of the fish gave it a unique texture.

meanings.definition: The lack of refinement or sophistication in something.
meanings.sent1: The rawnesses of his manners were evident at the dinner party.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't overlook the rawnesses of the painting's brush strokes.
meanings.sent3: The rawnesses of the joke made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The rawnesses of the performance added charm to the play.
meanings.sent5: The rawnesses of the music captured the audience's attention.
